info.name: URL Bar Tweaks - Remove Visit/Search & Limit Width
info.description:
Firefox 57 or Stylish 3.0 users: Please go to https://www.jeffersonscher.com/gm/url-bar-tweaks.html to install.
Stylish 2.x users: Use the "Customize Settings" button before installation.

Remove the top line added in Firefox 43+ (site - Visit, text - Search with...) from the address bar autocomplete drop-down, reduce size of Firefox 48+ dropdown or use an older-style two-line layout or Firefox 2 Oldbar layout, keep the dropmarker displayed even when not hovering the address bar. URLbar AKA Location Bar AKA Awesomebar

To restore a two-line drop-down in Firefox 48+, see "Drop-down Style" choice (2) below. For Oldbar fixed width URL-title layout, see choice (3).
info.additionalInfo:
Choose your style first, then the corresponding options are keyed to its number (e.g., style (1) has options (1A) and (1B)).

As of May 9th, there is no way to revise your initial selection through this page. If you didn't get them the way you want, unfortunately you have to completely remove the style from the Add-ons page, User Styles section, and then reload this page and choose your style setting options again.

Additional Screenshots: "Oldbar" Style • Highlight color, Text boxing options • Dark theme option • Firefox 43-47 Style

After installing the style, try it out by typing something in the address bar. - - - - - - - - - - - - - The number of items on the drop-down is determined by a setting you can modify in the about:config preferences editor. Here's how: (1) In a new tab, type or paste about:config in the address bar and press Enter/Return. Click the button promising to be careful. (2) In the search box above the list, type or paste URLB and pause while the list is filtered (3) Double-click the browser.urlbar.maxRichResults preference and enter the desired value, for example, change 10 to 15 (one is lost because of the hiding of the Visit/Search item, so 15 actually shows 14 rows) (4) To test, launch a new window using Ctrl+n (on Mac, Cmd+n) To update this style for the new number of rows, reload this page until you get a green Update button, then you can update the number of rows to display without a scroll bar, and Update. - - - - - - - - - - - - - 2018-10-22 Many more updates for Firefox 70 2018-09-03 Updates for Firefox 70 (panel changed to div) 2018-07-08/09 Updates for Firefox 68 2017-09-28 Various tweaks for Quantum/Photon (Firefox 57+) 2016-12-03 Add a dark theme color option 2016-11-06 Add an "Oldbar" style (Firefox 2 fixed columns, URL left, Title right) 2016-08-28 Add matched text styling option, minor corrections throughout 2016-08-21 Add text and background color options for highlighted item (Firefox 48 only) 2016-08-14 Add width and font size options for the Firefox 48 one line drop-down 2016-08-07 Suppress "empty bar" box, add option to restore scroll bar 2016-08-04 Created experimental two-line drop-down layout for Firefox 48 2016-07-17 Added optional exception for search keywords per https://forum.userstyles.org/discussion/50453/suggestion-dont-hide-search-with-when-using-keywords 2016-06-26 Fixed bug: search suggestions blocked after previous change 2016-06-20 Added support for Firefox 48-49 (currently known as Beta and Developer Edition). 2016-03-22 Drop-down height rule tweaked to allow shrink-to-fit (hopefully).

data.title: Suggestion: don't hide "Search with" when using keywords
Can you make a "dark" theme version?
Could you add a version that allows variable url bar width dependant on window size?
[May 1 Workaround] Insert Missing Style Settings Controls
Very intensive Userstyle (lot of options)for the Firefox Quantum!

options.label: Small - 12px
options.value:
/* Font-sizes */
    #PopupAutoCompleteRichResult .autocomplete-richlistitem:not([actiontype="searchengine"]) .ac-title,
    #PopupAutoCompleteRichResult .autocomplete-richlistitem:not([actiontype="searchengine"]) .ac-url,
    #PopupAutoCompleteRichResult .autocomplete-richlistitem:not([actiontype="searchengine"]) .ac-action,
    #urlbarView-results .urlbarView-row:not([type="search"]) .urlbarView-title,
